s0021: Although Gong Liu was among the Rong and Di barbarians, he revived Houji's work, devoted himself to farming and planting, practiced what was suitable for the land, from Qi and Ju crossed the Wei, took timber for use, travelers had provisions, residents had stores, the people relied on his good fortune.
s0022: The common people cherished him, many migrated and sought protection in returning to him.
s0023: The rise of the Zhou way began from this, therefore poets sang and delighted in thinking of his virtue.
s0024: Gong Liu died, his son Qing Jie ascended, established the state at Bin.
s0025: Qing Jie died, his son Huang Pu ascended.
s0026: Huang Pu died, his son Cha Fu ascended.
s0027: Cha Fu died, his son Hou Zhu ascended.
s0028: Hou Zhu died, his son Gong Bo ascended.
s0029: Gong Bo died, his son Tai Wang ascended.
s0030: Tai Wang had sons Tai Bo, Yu Zhong, and Ji Li.
